creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Marilyn Tupper Doe
description: July: night scene: street lined with buildings and yellow glowing lanterns; towering spire with mass of yellow glowing lanterns at center; crowds of men in Western dress, and women in kimono along street, mostly silhouetted against lights
medium: Color woodblock print: ink and colors on paper
title: Twelve Months of Kyoto (Gorgeous procession of "Yama-hoko" or the floats at the Gion festival)
